title: Application of the concept maps in the realisation of university biological programme content
segmentation: Dear colleagues, first of all, I would like to express my gratitude to professor season, who invited me to participate in this conference.

And as you know, I'm coming from Serbia and I'll try to present one dialectical approach that we use in work with our students and which is related to the application of information and communications technologies.
The application of these technologies.

Especially the various software packages has not been extended in teaching at different levels of education in our country, and from this aspect it is a very important that we also consider this a problem and adapt to the world trends other.
Now introduce a concept Maps concept mapping procedure that we using in teaching and in designing.
The teaching process, specifically in the courses of anatomy and morphology of invertebrates, biology of bees with beekeeping and the tactics of biology.
It's a concept map.
What do we think of 1st?
Very often the concept Maps have been equated with mind Maps and most do not understand the differences between these visual teaching technologies.
Concept Maps are more consistently more precisely more formal and more specific in comparing with other similar visual technologies.

For example, as in mind Maps or conceptual diagrams, For these reasons, a large amount of teaching content, in particular biological program content, can be presented concisely with the help of map and the most important concepts and their relations thus can be briefly summarized and highlighted.
Concept mapping has been starting by Professor Joseph Novak from Cornell University and the great contribution for developing an analyzing constant.
Maps belongs to professor.
Yanking came from University of Surrey, United Kingdom, and what is important Professor Novac and Professor King King are biologists.
So what has led biologists?
To develop such a system that helps in process of learning and teaching, what kind of science is biology?
How many concepts and facts are contained in it?
Certainly on.
Measurable number and it is a very broad science of life in all its aspects.
So.
It was necessary to create a system which is very conscious, vain precicely summarize everything.
What is important and expose it.
And these are just the concept Maps concept map is consisted of concepts and their relations.
Even now the on Slide 7.
Figure one concept map honeybee.
And we can see on the slide that concepts are honey.
Be well organized SoC honey walks be venom and linking words.
Our lives in an produces.
Then
Figure 2 functions of concept map.
There are several hours that Darryl of several functions of concept map.
We can see that they can serve in planning and preparation, realization and revision, and assessment in teaching process also.
There is a procedure for constructing concept Maps.
First, defining the field of knowledge defining the focus question, defining important concepts and their relations.
Creating a preliminary concept.
Minton and revision of preliminary map construction of the final concept map on the slide the, Let's say 13.
This is a focus question.
First.
For example, Akina terms in an Atom in morphology of invertebrates.
What are acting Adams and the parking lot of concepts on the right side?
Then
It is the first design concept map.
Preliminary map.
Akinade rooms with some concepts in the scaffold of the map.
And the same concept on the parking lot yet and then.
It is the final consonant, after revision.
Some steps of revision.
And all concepts are in the scaffold of the concept map.
So.

One of the most popular software program for construction of concept Maps is see Map Tools developed for Professor Kindness and navaka, and it's available for download and this software helps in construction and modification of concept Maps.
Also, it allows support for collaborative work over a long distance in the construction of Maps and their publishing.
The concept Maps built using see map tools can be stored on servers and where anybody?
Can access them.
So far we have been researching the applet.
Nation of concept Maps in at our faculty at University, in Belgrade biology faculty in the course of human anatomy and Physiology and in Zoological courses so.
We found that Maps are very suitable.
And the contributed to process of learning and teaching, but has been.
Proven with a test of knowledge.
And the students express also satisfaction in creating Maps in the process of learning and testing with the application of this technology.

And in a Slide 25, this is example of concept Maps use in teaching subject a concept map for the syllabi of anatomy and morphology on invertebrates, and you can see the elements of this syllabus and the learning outcomes.
We say learning outcomes, not learning objects and out concerned at the second level so.
Concept Maps can be also used in this process.
Example of concept map for evaluation of a client knowledge in course of anatomy.
Mythology of invertebrates.
A concept map for Canadians and the student.
Students need to put adequate concept in box invite box.
And to evaluate their knowledge self employed their knowledge.

So very briefly, application of concept Maps directly contributed to better learning and teaching process, and it is necessary to provide the training for teachers and students to apply this technology and the intention is that in future it becomes a usual teaching technology in many Zoological courses and in other courses.

In our faculty and the teachers, students will be gradually trained for the application of this technology based upon the obtained result mapping will be further implemented at the University of Belgrade to improve the curriculum and the teaching and learning process.
Further research about concept mapping is planned in the.
Offer a vision of the curriculum for the logical subject and does the concept Maps will be used for organizing and structuring the curriculum of these subjects.
It is expected that this will allow University teachers to easily create and organize the curriculum as well as connect and quality.
Present the teaching units.
Thank you.
Thank you very much.
